title: 114_hr4302
content: The curr_chunk is about the termination of bank functions. The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating functions transferred from the Bank. All functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. The Secretary must report to Congress when this determination is made. The Secretary must ensure all obligations of the Bank and others are satisfied before the abolishment date. Once this is determined, the Secretary will report to Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for ensuring all obligations of the Bank are met before the abolishment date and reporting to Congress. The Secretary is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of transferred functions, outstanding obligations, and affairs of the Bank. They may delegate functions to wind up and dissolve transferred functions. The Secretary is responsible for implementing the Act, including the dissolution of the Bank's functions and affairs. The Secretary may delegate actions necessary to wind up and dissolve transferred functions, with no authorization for Bank positions after 60 days of abolishment. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS AND REPEALS. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed. Sections of various acts related to the Export-Import Bank are repealed, including sections from the Export-Import Bank Act Amendments of 1978 and the Bank Export Services Act. Public Law 90-390 and sections of the Trade and Development Act are also repealed. Sections from various acts related to the Export-Import Bank, including the Bank Export Services Act and Public Law 90-390, are repealed. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of different acts, including the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 and title 31 of the United States Code. It involves the elimination of certain subsections and paragraphs within these acts. Amendments are made to sections of the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 and title 31 of the United States Code, including the elimination of specific positions at level iii and iv within these acts. Amendments are made to the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 and title 31 of the United States Code, including the elimination of positions at level iv in the Export-Import Bank of Washington and the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. Amendments are made to the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 and title 31 of the United States Code, including the elimination of positions at level iv in the Export-Import Bank of Washington and the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. The amendments involve removing the Office of Inspector General for the Bank and providing an effective date for the changes. Additionally, a report to Congress on other necessary amendments to Federal statutes is required. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal laws, executive orders, rules, regulations, or documents pertaining to a department from which a function is transferred by this Act will now refer to the department or office to which the function is transferred. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. The term "function" includes duties, powers, activities, and programs. The term "office" includes agencies, bureaus, councils, and organizational entities.
